out_data: What are the names of projects that are related to disaster and have a start date later than 2021?

in_data: What are the names of projects that are related to disaster and have a start date later than 2021?
out_data: ['Projects related to disaster', 'Projects with a start date later than 2021']

[Document(page_content='Page 8 of 8 
 
 
Agenda Item # 4.A. 
awarded a FEMA Hazard Mitigation grant to fund the design, engineering and 
environmental compliance needed for a shovel ready project.  Phase Two of 
the Emergency Warning Sirens project will be implementation of the design 
plan, including purchasing, installing, and testing the sirens.  The City will 
apply for future grant funding for this phase of the project. 
¾ Upates: 
\x83 On November 30, 2021, City Council approved an agreement with 
Acoustic Technology to design the outdoor warning sirens.  A design 
report will be presented to Council upon completion. 
¾ Estimated Schedule: TBD 
 
Disaster Projects (Construction) 
None at this time 
 
Disaster Projects (Completed) 
 
Citywide Guardrail Replacement 
Project Description: This project consisted of replacing the damaged guardrails throughout 
the City caused by the Woolsey Fire on Encinal Canyon Road, Corral Canyon Road, and 
Kanan Dume Road.  The project was combined with the County of Los Angeles’ damaged 
guardrails.  The project was completed in February 2021. 
 
Malibu Park Storm Drain Repairs 
Project Description:  After the Woolsey Fire, subsequent storms caused damage to 
multiple storm drain facilities throughout Malibu.  The project repaired the storm drains on 
Cuthbert Road, Morning View Drive, Busch Drive at Harvester Road.  The project also 
included the repair of a storm drainage facility on Birdview Avenue.', metadata={'author': 'Yiming Lin', 'chunk_index': 11.0, 'creationDate': "D:20240119063224Z00'00'", 'creator': 'Safari', 'file_path': 'data/civic/raw_data/malibucity_agenda__01262022-1835.pdf', 'format': 'PDF 1.3', 'keywords': '', 'modDate': "D:20240119063224Z00'00'", 'page': 7.0, 'producer': 'macOS Version 14.2.1 (Build 23C71) Quartz PDFContext', 'source': 'data/civic/raw_data/malibucity_agenda__01262022-1835.pdf', 'start_index': 0.0, 'subject': '', 'title': 'https://www.malibucity.org/AgendaCenter/ViewFile/Agenda/_01262022-1835', 'total_pages': 8.0, 'trapped': ''}), Document(page_content='Page 6 of 8 
 
 
Agenda Item # 4.A. 
¾ Project Description:  This project will be funded through a grant from FEMA 
after the Woolsey Fire.  The City will create a complete inventory of storm 
drains, culverts, debris basins, manholes, and other drainage structures 
within the City.   
¾ Updates:  Council approved an agreement in December for design services.  
A kick-off meeting was held in late December. 
¾ Estimated Schedule: 
\x83 Completion Date:  Spring 2022 
 
Guardrail Replacement Citywide (FEMA Project) 
¾ Project Description:  This project consisted of replacing the damaged 
guardrail throughout the City as a result of the Woolsey Fire. 
 
Corral Canyon Road Bridge Repairs (FEMA Project) 
¾ Project Description:  This project consisted of replacing fire damaged existing 
fencing and repairing the damaged embankment adjacent to the bridge. 
 
Corral Canyon Culvert Repairs (FEMA Project) 
¾ Project Description:  This project has been cancelled as it could not get FEMA 
approval. 
¾  
Birdview Avenue Improvements (CalOES Project) 
¾ Updates: This project was included in the Malibu Park Drainage 
Improvement. 
 
Malibu Park Drainage Improvements 
¾ Updates: The Contractor completed the repairs to storm drains on Cuthbert 
Road, Morning View Drive, Busch Drive, Harvester Road and Birdview 
Avenue. This project is scheduled to be accepted by the Council at the 
January 24, 2022 meeting. 
 
Clover Heights Storm Drain (FEMA Project) 
¾ Project Description:  This project consists of design and construction of a few 
storm drains on Clover Heights.  The existing storm drain facility ends at the 
intersection of Clover Heights and Harvester Road.  During storms, this 
intersection floods and causes debris to block the road.  An extended storm 
drain towards the end of Clover Heights will help eliminate this issue. 
¾ Updates: 
\x83 Staff is currently preparing consultant proposals for the design of this 
project.  Proposals will be due in February/March.', metadata={'author': 'Yiming Lin', 'chunk_index': 7.0, 'creationDate': "D:20240119063224Z00'00'", 'creator': 'Safari', 'file_path': 'data/civic/raw_data/malibucity_agenda__01262022-1835.pdf', 'format': 'PDF 1.3', 'keywords': '', 'modDate': "D:20240119063224Z00'00'", 'page': 5.0, 'producer': 'macOS Version 14.2.1 (Build 23C71) Quartz PDFContext', 'source': 'data/civic/raw_data/malibucity_agenda__01262022-1835.pdf', 'start_index': 0.0, 'subject': '', 'title': 'https://www.malibucity.org/AgendaCenter/ViewFile/Agenda/_01262022-1835', 'total_pages': 8.0, 'trapped': ''}), Document(page_content='Page 1 of 6 
 
 
Agenda Item # 4.A. 
Public Works Commission 
Agenda Report 
 
 
To: 
Chair Merrick and Members of the Public Works Commission 
 
Prepared by:  
Robert DuBoux, Public Works Director/City Engineer 
 
Date prepared:  
February 18, 2021  
 
 
Meeting date: March 2, 2021 
 
Subject: 
 
Capital Improvement Projects and Disaster Recovery Projects Status 
Report 
 
 
RECOMMENDED ACTION:  Receive and file report on the status of the City’s current and 
upcoming Capital Improvements Projects and Disaster Recovery Projects. 
 
DISCUSSION:  Staff will provide a status update on the following active projects in the 
Fiscal Year 2020-2021 Capital Improvement Program: 
 
Capital Improvement Projects (Design) 
 
Marie Canyon Green Streets 
¾ Updates: 
\x83 The City has recently received Measure W funds to complete this 
project.  Staff is working on the project plans to prepare for public 
bidding. 
¾ Project Schedule:   
\x83 Complete Design: April 2021 
\x83 Begin Construction: Summer 2021 
 
PCH Median Improvements Project 
¾ Updates: 
\x83 Consultant is working on the final design. In March, the City be 
seeking 
proposals 
from 
consultants 
to 
perform 
construction 
management. 
¾ Project Schedule: 
\x83 Complete Design: February 2021 
\x83 Begin Construction: Fall 2021 
Public Works 
Commission Meeting 
03-02-21 
Item

out_data: The City has completed projects related to disaster recovery, such as the Citywide Guardrail Replacement and Malibu Park Storm Drain Repairs. Projects funded by FEMA and CalOES have been implemented to repair storm drains and replace damaged guardrails caused by the Woolsey Fire. The City is also working on other disaster-related projects, like the Clover Heights Storm Drain.

in_data: Projects with a start date later than 2021
out_data:
[Document(page_content='Page 3 of 6 
 
 
Agenda Item # 4.A. 
Malibu Park Drainage Improvements 
¾ Updates: 
\x83 Staff is making minor modifications to the project plans to reduce the 
overall project costs. 
\x83 Project is scheduled to go out to bid next week. 
¾ Project Schedule: 
\x83 Complete Design: February 2021 
\x83 Begin Construction: April 2021 
 
Capital Improvement Projects (Construction) 
 
City Hall Roof Replacement 
¾ Updates: The City has held project meetings with the contractor and is 
developing a project schedule. 
¾ Project Schedule: February – April 2021 
 
Bluffs Park Workout Station 
¾ Updates: The contractor is waiting for the delivery of the new workout 
station equipment.  The equipment is anticipated to be delivered at the end 
of February. 
¾ Project Schedule: November 2020 – March 2021 
 
Civic Center Way Improvements  
¾ Updates:  
\x83 Work Hours: Monday through Friday 7:00AM to 4:00PM, Saturdays 
7:00AM to 4:00PM 
\x83 The contractor is currently working at the section between Vista 
Pacifica and the condos on Civic Center Way.  This phase of work will 
require the temporary closure of Civic Center Way.  Portions of the 
curb and gutter have been placed and the contactor is working on the 
proposed retaining wall.  This portion of work is anticipated to be 
completed in early February 2021. 
\x83 The contractor is also working on the curb, gutter and storm drain 
installation on Civic Center Way from Webb Way to the condos.  This 
portion of the work may require temporary road closures.  However, it 
is anticipated that this phase of the project will be completed at the 
end of February 2021. 
¾ Project Schedule: August 2020 through March 2021', metadata={'author': 'Yiming Lin', 'chunk_index': 2.0, 'creationDate': "D:20240119063714Z00'00'", 'creator': 'Safari', 'file_path': 'data/civic/raw_data/malibucity_agenda__03022021-1648.pdf', 'format': 'PDF 1.3', 'keywords': '', 'modDate': "D:20240119063714Z00'00'", 'page': 2.0, 'producer': 'macOS Version 14.2.1 (Build 23C71) Quartz PDFContext', 'source': 'data/civic/raw_data/malibucity_agenda__03022021-1648.pdf', 'start_index': 0.0, 'subject': '', 'title': 'https://www.malibucity.org/AgendaCenter/ViewFile/Agenda/_03022021-1648', 'total_pages': 6.0, 'trapped': ''}), Document(page_content='Page 4 of 6 
 
 
Agenda Item # 4.A. 
Capital Improvement Projects (Not Started) 
 
Annual Street Maintenance 
¾ Project Description:  This project provides for the reconstruction and 
maintenance of City streets. 
¾ Estimated Schedule: 
\x83 Complete Design: Spring 2021 
\x83 Begin Construction: Summer 2021 
 
Bluffs Park Shade Structure 
¾ Project Description:  This project consists of the installation of four single-
post shade structures at Malibu Bluffs Park 
¾ Estimated Schedule: 
\x83 Complete Design: Summer 2021 
\x83 Begin Construction: Fall 2021 
 
Vehicle Protection Devices 
¾ Project Description:  Per Malibu Municipal Code Section 17.48.070 requires 
vehicle impact protection devices to be installed for all parking spaces 
located adjacent to any outdoor pedestrian seating area.  There are two 
locations within the City’s right-of-way and City-owned property that would 
require a vehicle impact protection device. 
¾ Estimated Schedule: 
\x83 Complete Design: Summer 2021 
\x83 Begin Construction: Fall 2021 
Malibu Road Slope Repairs 
¾ Project Description:  The existing slope adjacent to the beach access stairs 
at 24712 Malibu Road has been eroded and caused damage to Malibu 
Road. 
¾ Estimated Schedule: 
\x83 Complete Design: Fall 2021 
\x83 Begin Construction: Winter 2021 
 
Disaster Projects (Design) 
 
Broad Beach Road Water Quality Infrastructure Repairs 
¾ Updates: 
\x83 The project consultant has started the design of the project.  
¾ Project Schedule: 
\x83 Complete Design: Summer 2021 
\x83 Begin Construction: Fall 2021', metadata={'author': 'Yiming Lin', 'chunk_index': 3.0, 'creationDate': "D:20240119063714Z00'00'", 'creator': 'Safari', 'file_path': 'data/civic/raw_data/malibucity_agenda__03022021-1648.pdf', 'format': 'PDF 1.3', 'keywords': '', 'modDate': "D:20240119063714Z00'00'", 'page': 3.0, 'producer': 'macOS Version 14.2.1 (Build 23C71) Quartz PDFContext', 'source': 'data/civic/raw_data/malibucity_agenda__03022021-1648.pdf', 'start_index': 0.0, 'subject': '', 'title': 'https://www.malibucity.org/AgendaCenter/ViewFile/Agenda/_03022021-1648', 'total_pages': 6.0, 'trapped': ''}), Document(page_content='Page 2 of 6 
 
 
Agenda Item # 4.A. 
PCH Signal Synchronization System Improvements Project 
¾ Updates: 
\x83 65% design package was submitted to Caltrans in November 2020. 
\x83 Consultant is working on final design documents. 
¾ Project Schedule: 
\x83 Complete Final Design: May 2021 
\x83 Advertise: July 2021 
\x83 Award Contract and Begin Construction: September 2021 
 
Civic Center Stormwater Diversion Structure 
¾ Updates: 
\x83 A Los Angeles County Flood Control maintenance agreement is 
required for this project.  Staff is waiting for the County’s approval of 
the agreement. 
¾ Project Schedule: 
\x83 Complete Design: Completed. Awaiting maintenance agreement from 
the County. 
\x83 Begin Construction: Estimated Summer 2021 
 
Westward Beach Road Improvements Project 
¾ Updates: 
\x83 The project requires coordination with Los Angeles County Beaches 
and Harbor.  Staff is working out the final details of the project with 
the County and will be finalizing the design. 
¾ Project Schedule: 
\x83 Complete Design: Spring 2021 
\x83 Begin Construction: Fall 2021 
 
Civic Center Water Treatment Facility Phase 2 
¾ Updates: 
\x83 Project is at the 65% design phase. 
\x83 The City obtained a project CDP from Planning Commission on 
February 1, 2021. 
\x83 The State is reviewing the City’s application for the State Revolving 
Fund program. 
\x83 The project assessment engineer has begun the process of 
evaluating the project costs.   
\x83 Next public community meeting is scheduled for March 25th. 
¾ Project Schedule: 
\x83 Complete Design: December 2021 
\x83 Begin Construction: March 2022', metadata={'author': 'Yiming Lin', 'chunk_index': 1.0, 'creationDate': "D:20240119063714Z00'00'", 'creator': 'Safari', 'file_path': 'data/civic/raw_data/malibucity_agenda__03022021-1648.pdf', 'format': 'PDF 1.3', 'keywords': '', 'modDate': "D:20240119063714Z00'00'", 'page': 1.0, 'producer': 'macOS Version 14.2.1 (Build 23C71) Quartz PDFContext', 'source': 'data/civic/raw_data/malibucity_agenda__03022021-1648.pdf', 'start_index': 0.0, 'subject': '', 'title': 'https://www.malibucity.org/AgendaCenter/ViewFile/Agenda/_03022021-1648', 'total_pages': 6.0, 'trapped': ''})]

out_data: Projects with a start date later than 2021 include the Annual Street Maintenance project starting in Summer 2021, the Bluffs Park Shade Structure project beginning construction in Fall 2021, and the Vehicle Protection Devices project also starting construction in Fall 2021.

in_data: ['The City has completed projects related to disaster recovery, such as the Citywide Guardrail Replacement and Malibu Park Storm Drain Repairs. Projects funded by FEMA and CalOES have been implemented to repair storm drains and replace damaged guardrails caused by the Woolsey Fire. The City is also working on other disaster-related projects, like the Clover Heights Storm Drain.', 'Projects with a start date later than 2021 include the Annual Street Maintenance project starting in Summer 2021, the Bluffs Park Shade Structure project beginning construction in Fall 2021, and the Vehicle Protection Devices project also starting construction in Fall 2021.']
out_data: The projects that are related to disaster and have a start date later than 2021 include the Citywide Guardrail Replacement, Malibu Park Storm Drain Repairs, and Clover Heights Storm Drain. Additionally, the projects that are scheduled to start after 2021 are the Annual Street Maintenance project, the Bluffs Park Shade Structure project, and the Vehicle Protection Devices project.
